Someday when we’re dreaming

 Then we will remember
 Things we said today

These lines exercise a special technique to create nostalgia about the present by projecting an idea of the future. Paul explains the technique here:

It was a slightly nostalgic thing already, a future nostalgia: we’ll remember the things we said today, sometime in the future, so the song projects itself into the future and then is nostalgic about the moment we’re living in now, which is quite a good trick. It has interesting chords.

Some people think this song is riddled with such a nostalgic tone, because Paul was aware that the way they lived their lives would eventually drive them
apart.
